scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of various programs from recitals, plays, dance performances and concerts held in Brooklyn, dated 1910 to 1916.
Performers include the students of Irwin E. Hassell/Hassell Conservatory, Miss Marion Fillmer, William Pitt Rivers, and Martin P. Rivers.

Organizations include the Junior Musical Art and Literary Society of Brooklyn, Junior Dramatic Club of the Church of the Messiah, Sunshine Home for Blind Babies, and the Chateau du Parc Conservatory of Arts.

Venues include the New Montauk Theatre, St. Paul's Church, Y.M.C.A. Auditorium (Bedford Avenue and Monroe Street), Bradbury Recital Hall, U.S. Grant Post (Washington Avenue), Palais Revoir, Memorial Hall (Schermerhorn and Flatbush), and Commercial High School.
